places.generalDescription: The Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque is a stunning architectural marvel located in Abu Dhabi. It boasts 82 white domes of various sizes, making it one of the largest mosques globally. The mosque, constructed between 1996 and 2007, is made of white marble and features four minarets that stand over 100 meters tall.

sources.snippet: This popular religious landmark is as impressive on the inside as it is elaborate on the outside, with a unique lighting set-up that‚Äôs driven by the moon only adding to the experience. Home to the largest crystal chandelier on the planet and the world‚Äôs longest hand-knotted piece of carpet, the grandiose mosque was named after the UAE‚Äôs founding father Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan. Visitors are reminded to be respectful and cover up when visiting the mosque and women are required to cover their hair.

sources.snippet: Designed by the architect Yusuf Abdelki under the guidance of  Sheikh Zayed bin Sultan Al Nahyan, the Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque was constructed between 1994 and 2007 and sits atop 12 hectares. This Abu Dhabi landmark is the largest mosque in the UAE and the third largest in the world, the mosque can accommodate 40,100 worshippers. Architecturally, the mosque is a blend of various Islamic styles and features 82 domes, over 1,000 columns, and 24-carat-gold gilded chandeliers, as well as the world‚Äôs largest hand-knotted carpet.Free.

reviews.text:
THE LARGEST MOSQUE IN THE WORLD SHEIKH ZAYED GRAND MOSQUE. This is one of the biggest attractions of Abu Dhabi, it's a must visit place when u visit Dubai UAE. This MOSQUE is open to non-muslims, here people should wear decent clothes and ladies should cover their head.

It's constructed from White Marble and the carvings around it is just mind-blowing to see it. The architecture of the MOSQUE is very beautiful, it's really commendable how neat and clean they have maintained this huge MOSQUE hat's off to their effort in maintaining it. The white marble with gold carvings around the pillar and the entire structure, beautiful arches placed artistically is just mesmerizing to see.

The place is very peaceful you can feel it when you visit here. In some parts of the MOSQUE there is blue water pools along side of the huge number of beautifully carved pillars placed at equal distance. Words truly fall short to describe the beauty of this place, you need to come and feel it.

It's DIVINE experience visiting this MOSQUE. Here there is prayer hall where World's Largest Hand Weaven Carpet Is placed was awestruck to see that.
Hat's off to the Abu Dhabi and UAE for maintaining such a huge structure built with white marble, it looks and feels like as good as new but it's built decades ago.

When we visit this MOSQUE got to see the UAE fighter jets flying around which was fantastic to see here.
I say it's must visit place for people coming to Dubai.

As it's named " The Grand", it is so. The best time to visit the mosque is in the evening. You can see the beauty in the natural light and then the decorative night  lights. The view of the mosque in the water pool looks so amazing. Water fountains with lights are too good. The walls, columns, ceiling etc. are made so artistically. The Chandeliers are extraordinary.
You need to register yourself along with the number of visitors. Registration can be done via Mobile or machine booths. It's available towards the right side once you enter stairs. Also, a food court and many stores are available for food and shopping. There is a battery car available for pick and drop with some payment. You can see a lot of information on the walls with nice informative pictures. You must visit this place if you are visiting Abudhabi.

A Grand and Unforgettable Experience.

The Sheikh Zayed Grand Mosque is unlike anything I've ever seen. It's incredibly beautiful, grand, and massive - a true architectural masterpiece. The white marble, detailed carvings, elegant domes, and sparkling chandeliers create a peaceful yet majestic atmosphere that leaves a lasting impression.
Whether you visit during the day or at night, the mosque is absolutely stunning. It's open to all and very well organized, with respectful guidance.
A must-see in Abu Dhabi - truly one of the most magnificent mosques in the world.

places.generalDescription: Qasr Al Watan, located at one end of Abu Dhabi's main Corniche, is a grand presidential palace made of domed marble and limestone. Open to the public since 2019, it has quickly become a cherished cultural gem in the UAE. For an entry fee of Dhs60, visitors can explore its ornate interior featuring a mosaic-clad great hall, an extensive library with towering bookshelves, and exhibits that narrate the rich history of the nation.

sources.snippet: Heritage and design are the biggest calling cards at this Presidential complex. At home on the western end of the Corniche, Qasr Al Watan allows tourists to explore exhibitions that celebrate Arab customs and marvel at the elaborate design that reflects the region‚Äôs landscape. Featuring grandiose white domes, landscaped gardens and decked out in brilliant chandeliers, there is plenty to admire.
sources.shortName: 20 Must-Visit Attractions In Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Recently opened to the public, Qasr Al Watan (the UAE's Presidential Palace) has quickly become a must-do on Abu Dhabi itineraries for anyone interested in digging deeper into the culture, history, and architecture of the UAE. The grandiose interiors of the state rooms, including the Great Hall and Presidential Banqueting Hall, with their crystal chandeliers, domes, arches, vast amounts of marble, and intricate mosaic and muqarna (ornamental vaulting) detailing, is enough of a reason to visit. For those with a historic bent, the House of Knowledge exhibit space offers a thorough and well-curated collection that covers the Arab world's prominent role in the history of modern science, literature, and art.
sources.shortName: 17 Top-Rated Attractions & Things to Do in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Having opened in 2017, Qasr Al Watan is one of Abu Dhabi‚Äôs newest cultural landmarks. The Presidential Palace of the UAE, it houses the formal offices of both the President and the Crown Prince of Abu Dhabi. There‚Äôs the Great Hall with its mirrored cubes, curved glass panels, Arabesque patterns and symmetric marble panels, and the House of Knowledge, whose treasures include the first modern and accurate map of the Arabian Peninsula from 1561, the centuries-old Atlas astronomy manuscript, and Pliny‚Äôs Natural History encyclopedia.
sources.shortName: Top cultural attractions in Abu Dhabi

sources.snippet: Not nearly as famous as the Grand Mosque, yet, with construction only being completed in 2018 but set to become one of the grandest must-see buildings in the world, Qasr al Watan is the UAE‚Äôs Presidental Palace. It is a working government office, home to the Federal Supreme Council as well as open to tourists for most of the year for tours of the Grand Hall, library and gardens. The building is briefly lit each evening (now only Thu-Sat) for the Palace in Motion light and sounds show.
sources.shortName: 15 Unbelievable Abu Dhabi Landmark Buildings

sources.snippet: Yet another architectural landmark of Abu Dhabi, Qasr Al Watan, the Presidential Palace is a larger than life heritage structure which stands as a testimony of United Arab Emirates and its leaders. The beauty of the palace is not just in its infrastructure but also its reflective culture and governance. The multi-functional palace made with white granite and limestone is an architectural legacy br (Read More)imming with the best of UAE's artistry with excellence in design and decor.

sources.snippet: The working Presidential Palace was completed in 2008 and is the official meeting place for the UAE Cabinet and the Federal Supreme Council. Here, you‚Äôll also find the Qasr Al Watan Library and The Presidential Banquet where dignitaries are hosted. The Great Hall is the most striking example of traditional Arabian craftsmanship, from its central dome and archways to the intricate ornamentation and mosaic artistry.Dhs65 (adults), Dhs30 (kids).

sources.snippet: Abu Dhabi‚Äôs Presidential Palace is the emirate‚Äôs newest landmark, and a feast for the eyes. The library itself features important historic documents, including the UAE Constitution, as well as rare manuscripts and works of Arabian scholarship.

places.generalDescription: Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi on Yas Island is an indoor amusement park featuring rides and shows based on Warner Bros. cartoon characters and superheroes. It's conveniently located near various amenities such as hospitals, schools, hotels, malls, and entertainment options like Reem Central Park and Ferrari World. Additionally, there are plenty of nearby dining options and supermarkets for convenience. The park is easily accessible from Abu Dhabi International Airport and offers a fun-filled experience for visitors of all ages.

sources.snippet: The first indoor entertainment venue of its kind in the world, Warner Bros World is one of the newest attractions. The Yas Island park boasts six immersive lands: Bedrock, Dynamite Gulch, Cartoon Junction, Gotham City, Metropolis and Warner Bros Plaza. Among the plethora of activities available, it gives visitors the opportunity to meet and get photographs with well-known characters such as Batman, Superman, Bugs Bunny, Scooby-Doo and Tom & Jerry.

reviews.text: A very nice amusement park for children, compact enough to explore all attractions in a single day. While not extremely large, it offers a great variety of fun rides and activities. Surprisingly, a Flash Pass isn't really necessary, as we never had to wait more than 20 minutes for any attraction. The manageable size and reasonable wait times make it a stress-free and enjoyable experience for families. Highly recommended for those looking for a fun and well-organized amusement park for kids!

Fantastic Experience at Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi!

Had a fantastic day at Warner Bros. World Abu Dhabi with my family! It's an excellent place for kids, with amazing rides and a well-maintained environment. We truly enjoyed all the attractions, especially The Green Lantern: Galactic Odyssey and The Bedrock River Adventure. The park is well-designed, bringing the world of Warner Bros. to life in an exciting way.

The only downside is the food pricing. Similar to my recent visit to SeaWorld Abu Dhabi, the food courts here are extremely expensive. A simple Mountain Dew costs 18 AED-almost triple the usual price. While I understand the cost of maintaining such a fantastic theme park, I hope they consider making food and drinks more affordable for visitors.

Overall, it was a wonderful experience, and I highly recommend it for families looking for a fun-filled day!

As theme park enthusiasts we like this park. The indoor location ensure that the weather isn't affecting the park. It has some very good rides. The team are very friendly and helpful. The fay we went wasn't a busy day, so the wait times were optimal and we didn't need to wait more than 10 min for any ride. The park is clean, they have a variety of merchandise and the characters are reals to the character. What i feel was missing is the ambiance, the music and shows.

places.generalDescription: Etihad Towers is a contemporary complex of five towers in Abu Dhabi, offering a mix of shopping, dining, luxury accommodations, and an observation deck. The Avenue at Etihad Towers is a high-end retail destination featuring luxury brands like Hermes, Cartier, and Rolex as well as exclusive restaurants and commercial spaces. reviews.text: Ferrari World Abu Dhabi is an exciting and visually stunning experience, even if you don't get the chance to try the famous roller coaster. The decor is impressive, with sleek Ferrari designs and a fascinating display of high-speed cars that really showcase the brand's legacy. The exhibits are well-curated, offering a deep dive into the history of Ferrari and the world of motorsport. Though we didn't have enough time for the coaster ride, the overall atmosphere was thrilling, and the attention to detail in the displays made the trip worthwhile. It's a must-visit for car enthusiasts and anyone looking to experience the speed and luxury of Ferrari in a unique setting.

Amazing fast rides although not many for younger children. However, luckily my youngest is an adrenaline junkie so was happy with all the fast big rides. I'd highly recommend it to anyone visiting Abu Dhabi, especially if you love rollercoasters. The only downside was that it was hard to navigate the map and identify the different zones as they merged together, so we had to keep asking for directions to the rides and places we wanted to visit. Luckily the staff were really helpful. It would be great for more/better sign posts to different zones and main rides.

Absolutely amazing experience at Ferrari World Abu Dhabi! The rides are incredible  especially Formula Rossa and Flying Aces. Both are adrenaline-pumping and totally worth the hype. We bought the Quick Pass and it made a huge difference ,the wait times were minimal, and we got to enjoy the top attractions without the long queues.

The park is well-organized, clean, and packed with exciting things to do. If you're a thrill-seeker or just love roller coasters, this place is a must-visit. Totally exceeded our expectations 5 stars without a doubt!

reviews.text: A powerful symbol of unity and peace. The Abrahamic Family House brings together three faiths-Judaism, Christianity, and Islam-each represented by a stunning, thoughtfully designed house of worship. The architecture is beautiful, the atmosphere is serene, and the message is deeply moving. It's free to visit, just make sure to reserve online in advance. The Abrahamic Family House on Saadiyat Island is a remarkable architectural and cultural landmark that beautifully embodies the values of coexistence, respect, and interfaith harmony. The thoughtfully designed complex houses a mosque, a church, and a synagogue, each reflecting the unique heritage of its faith while seamlessly blending into a shared vision of unity.

The ambience is serene and inspiring, making it an ideal space for reflection, dialogue, and spiritual connection. The attention to detail in the architecture, the tranquil surroundings, and the warm hospitality of the staff all contribute to an enriching and meaningful experience.

Whether visiting for worship, cultural exploration, or simply to appreciate the significance of this initiative, the Abrahamic Family House stands as a powerful testament to Abu Dhabi's commitment to fostering mutual understanding and global peace. A must-visit for those interested in cultural and spiritual enrichment.

To enter the Islamic section (the mosque), you must remove your shoes, as per tradition. Unfortunately, there is no prior notice about this, and no place on-site to purchase shoe covers or socks.

Nice stadium. Stepping into the cricket stadium today was an exhilarating experience, one I will cherish for a long time. The sheer scale of the stadium, with its vast green field and towering stands, was awe-inspiring. Walking onto the pitch, I felt a surge of excitement and anticipation, as if I were stepping into the shoes of professional cricketers who have graced this ground before.

The match began with an electrifying atmosphere. The sound of bat meeting ball and the sight of players running across the field brought the game to life. As I took my place on the team, a mix of nerves and adrenaline coursed through me. Every moment on the field was intense-whether it was batting, bowling, or fielding. The thrill of hitting a boundary, taking a wicket, or stopping a crucial run was unmatched.

The camaraderie with my teammates added to the joy of the day. From strategizing on the field to sharing laughs during breaks, the match was not just about competition but also about bonding and teamwork. The opposing team played with great spirit, making the contest even more engaging and challenging.

The stadium, with its vibrant energy, made every moment memorable. The cheers from spectators, even if few, added to the competitive spirit and gave me a taste of what it might feel like to play in front of a packed audience.

By the end of the match, I was exhausted but thoroughly satisfied. Win or lose, the experience of playing cricket in a professional stadium was an unforgettable one. It was a reminder of the joy of sports, the value of teamwork, and the sheer fun of being part of a thrilling game.

places.name: Al Hilal Bank, Al Bahr Towers

reviews.text:
üëâOne of the top most, iconic buildings in Abu Dhabi,
üëâUnique shape of the buildings.
üëâSomething attractive famously also known as pineapple building
üëâInnovative style
üëâThe towers' solar shading system features a computer-controlled facade made up of thousands of translucent units

The 25-floor towers of Al Bahar have an amazing facade that was intended to refer to traditional Arabic architecture and design. Elevation in geometric patterns, consists of over 1000 moving elements that shrink and expand during the day, depending on the position of the sun, providing a more dynamic solution to climatic conditions. The panel lattice almost completely surrounds the two towers, except for the part of the buildings that faces north.

The shading system developed by a team of computer designers, architects and engineers is based on a parametric description of the geometry of the moving facades and simulation of its functions in response to sun exposure and the resulting change in incidence angles to different points throughout the year. Since in Abu Dhabi the temperature rarely drops below 35 * C and for much of the year it exceeds 50 * C, it was considered that in addition to investing in the building's air conditioning, it is also necessary to limit the heating of its interior.

The dynamic response of the panels to the movement of the sun, solar radiation inside the building, filters the light and reduces glare. At night, all the screens are curled up, allowing the glass of the facade to be seen. The system was named "mashrabiya" from traditional openwork architectural elements characteristic of Arab buildings since the Middle Ages.

Al Hilal Bank¬†(Arabic: ŸÖÿµÿ±ŸÅ ÿßŸÑŸáŸÑÿßŸÑ), Established in 2007, Al Hilal Bank was a Islamic bannk headquartered in Abu Dhabi (UAE) offering Shari'ah compliant Retail Banking, Treasury and Wealth Management.

Al Hilal Bank was acquired by ADCB Group. Al Hilal Bank retains its existing name and brand and operate as a separate Islamic banking entity within the group.

With issued capital of AED 4 billion and paid up capital of AED 3.5 billion, the Bank had credit ratings of A+ and A2 by Fitch and Moody's respectively. The Bank has 14 retail branches across the UAE and 3 branches in Kazakhstan through which they offer digital-based services, enhancing the Bank's performance-driven culture.

places.name: Landmark Tower

reviews.text:
The Landmark Tower, located on the Corniche in Abu Dhabi, is an iconic skyscraper that stands out with its modern design and impressive height. Overlooking the beautiful waterfront, it offers stunning views of the Arabian Gulf and the surrounding cityscape. The tower is a prominent feature of the Abu Dhabi skyline, making it a key destination for both locals and visitors. Its strategic location along the Corniche allows easy access to parks, beaches, and a variety of dining options nearby.

Mohammed Parvez

#LandmarkTower #AbuDhabi #Skyscraper #Architecture #ArabianGulf #Corniche #Cityscape #UAE #TravelAbuDhabi #VisitAbuDhabi #ModernDesign #WaterfrontViews #AbuDhabiSkyline #ExploreUAE #TouristAttraction

The Landmark Tower in Abu Dhabi, located on the Corniche side, is an iconic addition to the city's skyline. Standing tall with sleek, modern architecture, it offers stunning panoramic views of the Arabian Gulf and the vibrant cityscape. The tower houses luxury apartments, office spaces, and retail outlets, providing both residential comfort and commercial convenience. Its proximity to the Corniche makes it ideal for enjoying beachside leisure and scenic walks. The interiors are designed with elegance and functionality in mind, and the building maintains high standards of cleanliness and security. Overall, it's a prestigious address with a blend of lifestyle and location.

The Landmark Tower is an iconic residential development located in the heart of Abu Dhabi City.  This prestigious project is renowned for its architectural brilliance and innovative design. The tower is a symbol of luxury and sophistication offering residents a unique living experience.

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Abu Dhabi, the Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) Tower stands as a striking 40-story architectural marvel that adds to the city's impressive skyline. With its unique folding design inspired by traditional boat sails and flowing sand dunes, this skyscraper is often celebrated for its elegance and beauty.

sources.snippet: The ADIA HQ building on the Corniche is another architectual gem of the city skyline. It‚Äôs been overshadowed since completion my neighbouring Landmark ‚Äì but it‚Äôs fairly commonly agreed the ADIA tower is the far more beautiful and elegant of the two. Inspiration for the undulating feature folds of the building came from traditional billowing boat sails and swooping sand dunes.

sources.snippet: Right on the Corniche, it was the tallest building in Abu Dhabi for four years until 2010. At 185m tall it still makes its mark on the skyline, but it‚Äôs the unusual double curved frontage that gets it noticed more now. That, and at night most floors often have all the lights on which is quite an energy wasting yet spectacular sight.

places.name: Abu Dhabi Investment Authority

reviews.text: The Abu Dhabi Investment Authority (ADIA) is one of the world's largest sovereign wealth funds, established in 1976 by the government of Abu Dhabi, UAE. With a mandate to invest funds on behalf of the government, ADIA manages a diverse portfolio of global investments across various asset classes, including equities, fixed income, real estate, infrastructure, and alternative investments. Known for its long-term investment approach and prudent risk management, ADIA plays a crucial role in supporting Abu Dhabi's economic diversification and sustainable growth objectives. Through strategic investments in both domestic and international markets, ADIA aims to generate stable, long-term returns to support the future prosperity of Abu Dhabi and its citizens. With a reputation for professionalism, integrity, and excellence, ADIA continues to be a global leader in sovereign wealth management, contributing to the financial stability and resilience of the emirate of Abu Dhabi.

places.generalDescription: The Emirates Palace Mandarin Oriental in Abu Dhabi offers a unique and extraordinary culinary experience at Shang Palace, where local influences blend with oriental dishes to create one-of-a-kind flavors. The afternoon tea ceremony at the luxurious restaurant provides a tasteful and delicious experience, with attentive service and comfortable seating. Guests praise the exemplary staff, fantastic value for money, and exceptional coffee and cake. Visitors highly recommend this gem of a place for its overall exemplary experience.

sources.snippet: The palatial Emirates Palace is easily the most famous building in Abu Dhabi ‚Äî recognisable by its massive domed atrium, currently the largest in the world. The hotel first opened its doors to guests in 2005. Since then, it has been frequented by many high-profile celebrities, politicians, diplomats and the country‚Äôs ruling elite.
